alert.note: Alert for Fremont; Page (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 9:41PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Fremont and Page Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 941 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong winds associated with thunderstorm outflow along a line extending from 2 miles northwest of Shenandoah to 6 miles west of Coin to 3 miles northwest of Fairfax. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Emergency management. These winds have a history of overturning a semi. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree branches and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Coin and Blanchard around 955 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include College Springs, Clarinda, Shambaugh and Braddyville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for southwestern Iowa.
